item.title: Flooding to path in two areas across Blackheath public pathway, 27th January
item.description:
This flooding problem along this pathway has been going on for years and, it seems, has never been properly addressed. The pathway is sunken in places (but especially so in the two areas shown in the photos). Thus, when it rains heavily the water collects in substantial pools and the grass either side of the flooded area becomes a quagmire. This proves to be very difficult for people to traverse, particularly those less agile and with mobility issues who are likely to fall and sustain injuries.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tranquil Vale, Blackheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing Fly-Tipping and Vehicle Damage at 139 Anerley Road, 27th January
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to raise a formal complaint regarding ongoing fly-tipping by the tenant of 139 Anerley Road. This matter has been reported previously, and although some rubbish was removed following Council intervention, the tenant continues to dump waste in the area. Items include old appliances, fridges, car parts, windows, and loose screws and nuts, turning the area into a dumping ground. As a result, my car has been dented (photographic evidence available), another tenant’s vehicle has been damaged, and I have had to replace two tyres due to punctures caused by discarded screws and nuts. I have spoken to the tenant on several occasions, but he has ignored all concerns and continues to show no regard for neighbours’ safety or property. I am requesting that the Council treat this as a formal complaint, take enforcement action, and hold the tenant responsible for the environmental damage and harm caused to residents’ vehicles. Thank you for your attention. I look forward to your response. Yours faithfully, Mehdi Kahoul Tenant, Flat 2 141 Anerley Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Anerley Station Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
